commit.message: new logo for transition

verification.payload:
tree 18985707b3e6da806db460b826e31ceda7484667
parent 9a204a6a5ca62876b81137b40ed2e4e00ede0ca9
author Peter Bengtsson <mail@peterbe.com> 1516212695 -0500
committer Peter Bengtsson <mail@peterbe.com> 1516212695 -0500

new logo for transition

commit.message: fixes bug 1380705 - Events without picture break all sorts of things (#823)

only include events with a picture in roku channel (#822)

* only include events with a picture in roku channel

* fix test
fixes bug 1323009 - Vidly poster JPEG and CSP (#821)
Add pocket employee emails to ALLOWED_BID. (#820)
fixes bug 1353414 - Django 1.8.18 (#819)
fixes bug 1350474 - increase font color contrast in footer license note (#818)

fixes bug 1345571 - Upgrade to bleach 2.0 (#817)

* fixes bug 1345571 - Upgrade to bleach 2.0

* add webencodings==0.5
fixes bug 1329729 - Search field & button are misaligned on Air Mozilla website (#816)
Remove 'Persona' reference from the login page. (#814)
fixes bug 1323187 - When Auth0 is down we shouldn't fail entirely (#815)
Disable transcripts in search
fixes bug 1318323 - IntegrityErrors trying to save the same VidlyTagDomain (#813)
fixes bug 1318081 - don't call _set_csp_update on unfinished videos (#812)
never save empty VidlyTagDomain domains (#811)
fixes bug 1318016 - Cope better when id_token refresh fails (#810)
more verbose info about vidly tag domains (#809)
make vid.ly URLs config (#808)
fixes bug 1317435 - reset cached on vidly cdn domains (#807)
bug 1316897 - more aggressive refresh_old_vidly_tag_domains cron job (#806)

fixes bug 1317435 - Admin tool to manually reset vidly CDN lookups (#805)

* fixes bug 1317435 - Admin tool to manually reset vidly CDN lookups

* update to fix tests
fixes bug 1315730 - Replace Persona sign-in button with a link to Auth0 (#804)
fixes bug 1315730 - Replace Persona sign-in button with a link to Auth0

nicer sign-in page (#803)

* nicer sign-in page

* test fix
bug 1316898 - mozilla logo in auth0 lock (#802)
fixes bug 1316897 - Background refresh Vidly tag domains (#801)
fixes bug 1316895 - Sign In page should use is_active (#799)
fixes bug 1316878 - Store vid.ly HEAD domain lookups (#798)
fixes bug 1316688 - Refactor use of dot_dict function (#797)
fixes bug 1316645 - List aliases in User management (#796)

issue_comments.body:
The only thing I can missing is that the django-bootstrap-form package is supposed to go into "vendor-local". It's not enough to add it to requirements/prod.txt. (which I think sucks but that will change in the near future)

Check out http://playdoh.readthedocs.org/en/latest/packages.html about installing to vendor-local.
r- on the weak unauthorized tests. Fix that and let me know.
r+ with some nits on the cleaning of the email address.
r+ with a nit on the tag string split.
r+ but I would like to see the protection for whitespace in the crud forms.

r-

Let's fix all the URLs to make them end on a / so we can get rid of the URL part in the `action="..."` attributes. 
Also, would be great to see an improvement to the `icontains` matcher.

r+ Awesome work!

Only nit is that I'd like to see a trailing `/` on the URLs with a `\d+` on them too.

Impressive! r+

don't forget to rebase into one neat commit.
r+ if you fix the class attribute variables on the EventManager

commit_comments.body: r+
Pin the tag or the commit ID.
Django TestCase comes with an assertion for checking redirects. Use that instead.
note - all these were obsoleted in the refactor, c27cdf726c7fbe04b4b6f811846be010c4df13ef
shouldn't that be `', '.join(...`
All the other urls just have `<id>` as their identifier. I think you can do that here too.
nope, the tags are displayed by select2, which uses comma-separated text.  `', '` would add spaces to the tags
Actually. Perhaps it's good to use a more descriptive variable name. This is not a "traditional" edit view after all.
no need for a bracket
r+
`raise Http404("Event not approved")`
r+
why only 60 seconds? if it is properly invalidates it can be minutes, hours, ... ?
Good point. It was something I wrote early before I knew I could so confidently invalidate it.
You might as well do `data = json.loads(data)` and insert it into the model as a dict.

+

review_comments.body: Sorry, that should go in the `class Meta:`

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+from django import forms
+
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.contrib.auth.forms import UserChangeForm
+
+
+class UserEditForm(UserChangeForm):
+    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
+        super(UserEditForm, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
+        self.fields.pop('username')
+        self.fields.pop('password')
+
+    class Meta:
+        model = User
+        fields = ('is_active', 'is_staff', 'is_superuser',
review_comments.body: ah! why pop 'username' and 'password' when it's not in `Meta.fields`?
What's this for?

Make this a separate .html file so you can do something like 

```
...
{% include "_form_buttons.html" %}
</form>
```

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@

+from django.contrib.auth.forms import UserChangeForm
+
+

review_comments.body: There's a weird bug where excluding username and password from fields (or adding it to exclude_fields) doesn't work for this form, because it's based on the usereditform from django admin.  This was the offered solution online - I'll try to find the reference.
It's a variable used to highlight the active menu item - poorly named, actually, I'll fix that.

Use a helper function to instead of showing the last_login, turn it into a string like "3 hours ago". 
There is a function somewhere in django which we can use.

No need to change it. Seems reasonable. I was just curious.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@

+
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.contrib.auth.forms import UserChangeForm
+
+
+class UserEditForm(UserChangeForm):
+    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
review_comments.body: Ok, I realized I wasn't actually gaining anything from the userchangeform - it's a standard form now and doing just as well without the hack.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,3 +20,15 @@ def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
 
     class Meta:
         model = Group
+
+
+class UserFindForm(forms.ModelForm):
+    class Meta:
+        model = User
+        fields = ('email',)
+
+    def clean_email(self):
+        email = self.cleaned_data['email']
+        if User.objects.filter(email=email).count() == 0:
review_comments.body:
Is it perhaps safer to be case-iNsensitive?
Also, you don't need to do the `.count() == 0`. This should suffice:

``` python
if not User.objects.filter(email__iexact=email):
    raise ...
```
Shouldn't that be `href="?page={{ users.number }}"`?

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,3 +20,15 @@ def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
 
     class Meta:
         model = Group
+
+
+class UserFindForm(forms.ModelForm):
+    class Meta:
+        model = User
+        fields = ('email',)
+
+    def clean_email(self):
review_comments.body:
In fact, with the case insensitivity, it should be like this instead:

``` python
try:
    user = User.objects.get(email__iexact=email)
except User.DoesNotExist:
    raise ValidationError...
return user.email
```

That way, the form will accept "peTErBe@Gmail.COm" but spit out "peterbe@gmail.com"

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,81 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
review_comments.body: tip: always prefix all `self.client.login()` with `assert` to always be certain it worked.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
review_comments.body:
instead of checking for 302, do something like

```
eq_(response['location'], settings.LOGIN_URL)
```

or something like that. 302s can happen just because of various redirects for legacy or for adding or removing a '/'.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_not_staff(self):
+        """ User is not staff - should be rejected. """
+        self._staff_login(False)
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
review_comments.body:
The name is misleading. Just name the private method `_login()` and do something like:

```
self._login(is_staff=True | False)
```

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_not_staff(self):
+        """ User is not staff - should be rejected. """
+        self._staff_login(False)
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_staff_home(self):
+        """ User is staff - should get an OK homepage. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 200)
+
+    def test_staff_logout(self):
+        """ Log out makes admin inaccessible. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        self.client.get(reverse('auth.logout'))
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_edit_user(self):
+        """ Unprivileged admin - shouldn't see user change page. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.users'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+
+class TestUsersAndGroups(TestCase):
+    def setUp(self):
+        User.objects.create_superuser('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+
+    def test_user_edit(self):
+        """ Add superuser and staff status via the user edit form. """
+        user = User.objects.create_user('no', 'no@no.com', 'no')
+        response = self.client.post(reverse('manage.user_edit',
+                                            kwargs={'id': user.id}),
+            {
+                'is_superuser': 'on',
+                'is_staff': 'on',
+                'is_active': 'on'
+            }
+        )
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+        user = User.objects.get(id=user.id)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_superuser)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_staff)
review_comments.body: If you're going to use the nose tools, also use `ok_` instead of `self.assertTrue`

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_not_staff(self):
+        """ User is not staff - should be rejected. """
+        self._staff_login(False)
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_staff_home(self):
+        """ User is staff - should get an OK homepage. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 200)
+
+    def test_staff_logout(self):
+        """ Log out makes admin inaccessible. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        self.client.get(reverse('auth.logout'))
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_edit_user(self):
+        """ Unprivileged admin - shouldn't see user change page. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.users'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+
+class TestUsersAndGroups(TestCase):
+    def setUp(self):
+        User.objects.create_superuser('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+
+    def test_user_edit(self):
+        """ Add superuser and staff status via the user edit form. """
+        user = User.objects.create_user('no', 'no@no.com', 'no')
+        response = self.client.post(reverse('manage.user_edit',
+                                            kwargs={'id': user.id}),
+            {
+                'is_superuser': 'on',
+                'is_staff': 'on',
+                'is_active': 'on'
+            }
+        )
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+        user = User.objects.get(id=user.id)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_superuser)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_staff)
+
+    def test_group_add(self):
+        """ Add a group. """
+        response = self.client.post(reverse('manage.group_new'),
+            {
+                'name': 'fake_group'
+            }
+        )
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+        group = Group.objects.get(name='fake_group')
+        self.assertTrue(group is not None)
+        self.assertTrue(group.name == 'fake_group')
review_comments.body: `eq_`

         except User.DoesNotExist:
             raise forms.ValidationError('User with this email not found.')
         return user.email
+
+
+class EventRequestForm(forms.ModelForm):
+    tags = forms.CharField()

review_comments.body: What if `tags == ' one,,  two , '`?

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -34,3 +36,24 @@ def clean_email(self):
         except User.DoesNotExist:
             raise forms.ValidationError('User with this email not found.')
         return user.email
+
+
+class EventRequestForm(forms.ModelForm):
+    tags = forms.CharField()
+
+    def clean_tags(self):
+        tags = self.cleaned_data['tags']
+        split_tags = tags.split(',')
+        final_tags = []
+        for tag_name in split_tags:
+            t, created = Tag.objects.get_or_create(name=tag_name)
review_comments.body:
When you get a variable you don't need it's common practice to use `__`. Ie.:

```
t, __ = Tag.objects.get_or_create(name=tag_name)
```

I think pyflake would have complained about `created` not being used.

review_comments.diff_hunk:

             raise forms.ValidationError('User with this email not found.')
         return user.email

+    tags = forms.CharField()
+
+    def clean_tags(self):
+        tags = self.cleaned_data['tags']
+        split_tags = tags.split(',')
+        final_tags = []
+        for tag_name in split_tags:
+            t, created = Tag.objects.get_or_create(name=tag_name)
review_comments.body: check.py doesn't complain for some reason.

tree 18985707b3e6da806db460b826e31ceda7484667
parent 9a204a6a5ca62876b81137b40ed2e4e00ede0ca9
author Peter Bengtsson <mail@peterbe.com> 1516212695 -0500
committer Peter Bengtsson <mail@peterbe.com> 1516212695 -0500

new logo for transition

commit.message: fixes bug 1380705 - Events without picture break all sorts of things (#823)

only include events with a picture in roku channel (#822)

* only include events with a picture in roku channel

* fix test
fixes bug 1323009 - Vidly poster JPEG and CSP (#821)
Add pocket employee emails to ALLOWED_BID. (#820)
fixes bug 1353414 - Django 1.8.18 (#819)
fixes bug 1350474 - increase font color contrast in footer license note (#818)

fixes bug 1345571 - Upgrade to bleach 2.0 (#817)

* fixes bug 1345571 - Upgrade to bleach 2.0

* add webencodings==0.5
fixes bug 1329729 - Search field & button are misaligned on Air Mozilla website (#816)
Remove 'Persona' reference from the login page. (#814)
fixes bug 1323187 - When Auth0 is down we shouldn't fail entirely (#815)
Disable transcripts in search
fixes bug 1318323 - IntegrityErrors trying to save the same VidlyTagDomain (#813)
fixes bug 1318081 - don't call _set_csp_update on unfinished videos (#812)
never save empty VidlyTagDomain domains (#811)
fixes bug 1318016 - Cope better when id_token refresh fails (#810)
more verbose info about vidly tag domains (#809)
make vid.ly URLs config (#808)
fixes bug 1317435 - reset cached on vidly cdn domains (#807)
bug 1316897 - more aggressive refresh_old_vidly_tag_domains cron job (#806)

fixes bug 1317435 - Admin tool to manually reset vidly CDN lookups (#805)

* fixes bug 1317435 - Admin tool to manually reset vidly CDN lookups

* update to fix tests
fixes bug 1315730 - Replace Persona sign-in button with a link to Auth0 (#804)
fixes bug 1315730 - Replace Persona sign-in button with a link to Auth0

nicer sign-in page (#803)

* nicer sign-in page

* test fix
bug 1316898 - mozilla logo in auth0 lock (#802)
fixes bug 1316897 - Background refresh Vidly tag domains (#801)
fixes bug 1316895 - Sign In page should use is_active (#799)
fixes bug 1316878 - Store vid.ly HEAD domain lookups (#798)
fixes bug 1316688 - Refactor use of dot_dict function (#797)
fixes bug 1316645 - List aliases in User management (#796)

issue_comments.body:
The only thing I can missing is that the django-bootstrap-form package is supposed to go into "vendor-local". It's not enough to add it to requirements/prod.txt. (which I think sucks but that will change in the near future)

Check out http://playdoh.readthedocs.org/en/latest/packages.html about installing to vendor-local.
r- on the weak unauthorized tests. Fix that and let me know.
r+ with some nits on the cleaning of the email address.
r+ with a nit on the tag string split.
r+ but I would like to see the protection for whitespace in the crud forms.

r-

Let's fix all the URLs to make them end on a / so we can get rid of the URL part in the `action="..."` attributes. 
Also, would be great to see an improvement to the `icontains` matcher.

r+ Awesome work!

Only nit is that I'd like to see a trailing `/` on the URLs with a `\d+` on them too.

Impressive! r+

don't forget to rebase into one neat commit.
r+ if you fix the class attribute variables on the EventManager

commit_comments.body: r+
Pin the tag or the commit ID.
Django TestCase comes with an assertion for checking redirects. Use that instead.
note - all these were obsoleted in the refactor, c27cdf726c7fbe04b4b6f811846be010c4df13ef
shouldn't that be `', '.join(...`
All the other urls just have `<id>` as their identifier. I think you can do that here too.
nope, the tags are displayed by select2, which uses comma-separated text.  `', '` would add spaces to the tags
Actually. Perhaps it's good to use a more descriptive variable name. This is not a "traditional" edit view after all.
no need for a bracket
r+
`raise Http404("Event not approved")`
r+
why only 60 seconds? if it is properly invalidates it can be minutes, hours, ... ?
Good point. It was something I wrote early before I knew I could so confidently invalidate it.
You might as well do `data = json.loads(data)` and insert it into the model as a dict.

@@ -20,3 +20,15 @@ def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
 
     class Meta:
         model = Group
+
+
+class UserFindForm(forms.ModelForm):
+    class Meta:
+        model = User
+        fields = ('email',)
+
+    def clean_email(self):
+        email = self.cleaned_data['email']
+        if User.objects.filter(email=email).count() == 0:
review_comments.body:
Is it perhaps safer to be case-iNsensitive?
Also, you don't need to do the `.count() == 0`. This should suffice:

``` python
if not User.objects.filter(email__iexact=email):
    raise ...
```
Shouldn't that be `href="?page={{ users.number }}"`?

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,3 +20,15 @@ def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
 
     class Meta:
         model = Group
+
+
+class UserFindForm(forms.ModelForm):
+    class Meta:
+        model = User
+        fields = ('email',)
+
+    def clean_email(self):
review_comments.body:
In fact, with the case insensitivity, it should be like this instead:

``` python
try:
    user = User.objects.get(email__iexact=email)
except User.DoesNotExist:
    raise ValidationError...
return user.email
```

That way, the form will accept "peTErBe@Gmail.COm" but spit out "peterbe@gmail.com"

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
review_comments.body:
instead of checking for 302, do something like

```
eq_(response['location'], settings.LOGIN_URL)
```

or something like that. 302s can happen just because of various redirects for legacy or for adding or removing a '/'.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_not_staff(self):
+        """ User is not staff - should be rejected. """
+        self._staff_login(False)
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_staff_home(self):
+        """ User is staff - should get an OK homepage. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 200)
+
+    def test_staff_logout(self):
+        """ Log out makes admin inaccessible. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        self.client.get(reverse('auth.logout'))
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_edit_user(self):
+        """ Unprivileged admin - shouldn't see user change page. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.users'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+
+class TestUsersAndGroups(TestCase):
+    def setUp(self):
+        User.objects.create_superuser('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+
+    def test_user_edit(self):
+        """ Add superuser and staff status via the user edit form. """
+        user = User.objects.create_user('no', 'no@no.com', 'no')
+        response = self.client.post(reverse('manage.user_edit',
+                                            kwargs={'id': user.id}),
+            {
+                'is_superuser': 'on',
+                'is_staff': 'on',
+                'is_active': 'on'
+            }
+        )
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+        user = User.objects.get(id=user.id)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_superuser)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_staff)
review_comments.body: If you're going to use the nose tools, also use `ok_` instead of `self.assertTrue`

+from django.contrib.auth.models import User, Group
+from django.test import TestCase
+
+from funfactory.urlresolvers import reverse
+
+from nose.tools import eq_
+
+
+class TestPermissions(TestCase):
+    def _staff_login(self, is_staff=True):
+        u = User.objects.create_user('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        u.is_staff = is_staff
+        u.save()
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+        return u
+
+    def test_unauthorized(self):
+        """ Client with no log in - should be rejected. """
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_not_staff(self):
+        """ User is not staff - should be rejected. """
+        self._staff_login(False)
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_staff_home(self):
+        """ User is staff - should get an OK homepage. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 200)
+
+    def test_staff_logout(self):
+        """ Log out makes admin inaccessible. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        self.client.get(reverse('auth.logout'))
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.home'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+    def test_edit_user(self):
+        """ Unprivileged admin - shouldn't see user change page. """
+        self._staff_login()
+        response = self.client.get(reverse('manage.users'))
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+
+class TestUsersAndGroups(TestCase):
+    def setUp(self):
+        User.objects.create_superuser('fake', 'fake@fake.com', 'fake')
+        self.client.login(username='fake', password='fake')
+
+    def test_user_edit(self):
+        """ Add superuser and staff status via the user edit form. """
+        user = User.objects.create_user('no', 'no@no.com', 'no')
+        response = self.client.post(reverse('manage.user_edit',
+                                            kwargs={'id': user.id}),
+            {
+                'is_superuser': 'on',
+                'is_staff': 'on',
+                'is_active': 'on'
+            }
+        )
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+        user = User.objects.get(id=user.id)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_superuser)
+        self.assertTrue(user.is_staff)
+
+    def test_group_add(self):
+        """ Add a group. """
+        response = self.client.post(reverse('manage.group_new'),
+            {
+                'name': 'fake_group'
+            }
+        )
+        eq_(response.status_code, 302)
+
+        group = Group.objects.get(name='fake_group')
+        self.assertTrue(group is not None)
+        self.assertTrue(group.name == 'fake_group')
review_comments.body: `eq_`

review_comments.body:
When you get a variable you don't need it's common practice to use `__`. Ie.:

```
t, __ = Tag.objects.get_or_create(name=tag_name)
```

I think pyflake would have complained about `created` not being used.
